channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Jurassic footprints are discovered on a 'dinosaur highway' in southern England
item.description: The 166-million-year-old footprint tracks, found at a quarry in southern England, mark one of the largest discoveries in decades.
item.content:encoded: The 166-million-year-old footprint tracks, found at a quarry in southern England, mark one of the largest discoveries in decades.
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: A storm will bring heavy snow and dangerous ice from the Plains to the East Coast
item.description: This weekend's storm is expected to impact 62 million Americans through Monday. Heavy snow, ice, rain and severe thunderstorms are being unleashed from the Plains to the East Coast.
item.content:encoded:
This weekend's storm is expected to impact 62 million Americans through Monday. Heavy snow, ice, rain and severe thunderstorms are being unleashed from the Plains to the East Coast.

(Image credit: NWS Weather Prediction Center)
item.dc:creator: Mansee Khurana

item.title: Film director and screenwriter Jeff Baena, husband of Aubrey Plaza, dead at 47
item.description: The co-writer of I Heart Huckabees and director of The Little Hours was found dead at a Los Angeles residence on Friday. The Los Angeles Police Department is investigating the case.
item.content:encoded:
The co-writer of I Heart Huckabees and director of The Little Hours was found dead at a Los Angeles residence on Friday. The Los Angeles Police Department is investigating the case.

(Image credit: Mark Davis)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: A Pulitzer winner quits 'Washington Post' after a cartoon on Bezos is killed
item.description: Washington Post cartoonist Ann Telnaes resigned after an editor rejected her sketch satirizing tech chiefs, including the Post's owner and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.
item.content:encoded: Washington Post cartoonist Ann Telnaes resigned after an editor rejected her sketch satirizing tech chiefs, including the Post's owner and Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: How influencers are impacting journalism
item.description: NPR's Eric Deggans speaks to Summer Harlow of the Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas and V Spehar of UnderTheDeskNews about the role of influencers in journalism.
item.content:encoded:
NPR's Eric Deggans speaks to Summer Harlow of the Knight Center for Journalism in the Americas and V Spehar of UnderTheDeskNews about the role of influencers in journalism.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: Are reality TV stars employees? The National Labor Relations Board says yes
item.description: NPR's Eric Deggans asks Sonia Rao of The Washington Post about labor protections for people on reality television shows.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Eric Deggans asks Sonia Rao of The Washington Post about labor protections for people on reality television shows.
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: Vehicular attacks are not new. But preventing them has been a big challenge
item.description: For decades, individuals and terrorist groups have used vehicles to carry out deadly attacks. But installing safeguards hasn't always been successful.
item.content:encoded:
For decades, individuals and terrorist groups have used vehicles to carry out deadly attacks. But installing safeguards hasn't always been successful.

(Image credit: Jack Brook)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: Bats catch a lift from storm winds on long-distance migrations
item.description: Migrating hundreds and hundreds of miles is hard work for the common noctule bat. But this European species makes its marathon journey a little bit easier by paying attention to the weather.
item.content:encoded:
Migrating hundreds and hundreds of miles is hard work for the common noctule bat. But this European species makes its marathon journey a little bit easier by paying attention to the weather.

(Image credit: Kamran Safi)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Biden awards Medal of Freedom to Hillary Clinton, Soros, Messi and 16 others
item.description: Biden will also posthumously grant the medal to former U.S. Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy and former Michigan Gov. George Romney.
item.content:encoded:
Biden will also posthumously grant the medal to former U.S. Attorney General Robert F. Kennedy and former Michigan Gov. George Romney.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordo√±ez

item.title: Seeking to heal the country, Jimmy Carter pardoned men who evaded the Vietnam War draft
item.description: The pardon was one of the defining presidential moments for Jimmy Carter, who died Dec. 29 at the age of 100. The move was pilloried by members of the military and conservative politicians.
item.content:encoded: The pardon was one of the defining presidential moments for Jimmy Carter, who died Dec. 29 at the age of 100. The move was pilloried by members of the military and conservative politicians.
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez
